context.description: Error pages are part of the user experience, not just a technical fallback. When users hit a broken or unavailable page, they experience frustration, uncertainty, and sometimes distrust. Our responsibility is to turn that negative moment into a reassuring, helpful, and brand-consistent experience.
context.design_principle: These pages are visible to all user types, across web and mobile, and therefore must follow the same tone, branding, and visual system as the main site: calm, professional, and trustworthy, not overly playful or alarming

new_visitors.description: Users arriving from organic search, ads, or backlinks (external campaigns). They may be exploring DoktorABC for the first time.

returning_customers.description: Users who have purchased or consulted before. They might be revisiting bookmarked links or older URLs.

high_intent_users.description: Users who were completing a form, consultation, or payment when an error occurred.

support_seekers.description: Users seeking information about delivery, accounts, or prescriptions.

error_pages.context: This page appears when a user follows a broken link, mistypes a URL, or accesses a page that no longer exists. These users are 'lost', our job is to guide them back with clarity and empathy.

content.headline: 'Page Not Found' or 'We can't seem to find that page.'
content.body_copy: 'Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist or may have been moved.'
content.image: A clean, on-brand graphic, e.g a stylized, empty

error_pages.context: This occurs when DoktorABC experiences a temporary backend failure or technical issue (internal server error, bad gateway). The user did nothing wrong, our responsibility is to reassure them and guide them safely.

content.headline: 'Something went wrong on our end.'
content.body_copy: 'We're sorry, but we're experiencing a temporary technical issue. Our team has been automatically notified and is working to fix it. Please try refreshing the page in a few moments.'

buttons_and_actions.primary_button: 'Refresh This Page' - since 500 errors are often temporary, this is the main action
buttons_and_actions.secondary_button: 'Go to Homepage' - backup route if refresh doesn't resolve it
buttons_and_actions.key_link: 'Contact Support' - critical for users in checkout or consultation
